benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Remove tags from payment

covered: Valid deletion scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) cover the core delete operation across different tagDef configurations and header usage.
Comprehensive error handling coverage includes invalid paymentId (TC06), non-existent payment (TC07), missing header (TC08), unauthorized access (TC11), and invalid tagDef (TC09).
TagDefinition edge cases are exercised through removing present tagDefs (TC02/TC03), removing with a tagDef not on the payment (TC10), and guarding against injection (TC13).
Security and input validation are reinforced with tests for invalid inputs (TC09, TC13) and missing header (TC08).
System resilience is covered via service unavailability (TC12) and timeout (TC22) scenarios (503/504).
Concurrency (TC16) and performance under load (TC17) tests address stability and responsiveness under stress.
Data integrity and auditing are tested with data consistency after removal (TC21) and audit logging (TC20).
Regression (TC18) and backward compatibility (TC19) scenarios are included to catch regressions and ensure compatibility.
Boundary/edge-case coverage includes large tagDef sets (TC15) and handling of extra query parameters (TC14).
gaps: Soft-delete semantics (permanent vs. soft deletion) are not explicitly tested.
Authorization nuances beyond 401 (e.g., 403 Forbidden for insufficient permissions) are not covered.
Rate limiting/throttling scenarios are not tested.
Caching behavior (ETag, Cache-Control) is not tested for DELETE responses.
More rigorous concurrent-atomicity assertions could strengthen TC16 (final state determinism under concurrency).
recommendations: Add a test for 403 Forbidden to cover insufficient permissions even when a token is present.
Introduce rate-limiting tests to verify throttling and stability under bursts.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on DELETE responses where applicable.
Clarify and test soft-delete semantics if the system supports soft deletions for tags, otherwise document as permanent removal and align tests.
Enhance concurrency tests to deterministically verify final state under simultaneous deletions (e.g., multiple iterations or stronger synchronization in test setup).
